com.nwollmann.jgame

Class GameManager

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.nwollmann.jgame.GameManager

  • public class GameManager
extends java.lang.Object
    This class acts as the primary controller for the game engine.
    Author:
    Nicholas Wollmann

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      GameManager()
      Creates a new GameManager with no game objects or automatic game events.

    • Constructor Detail

      • GameManager

        public GameManager()
        Creates a new GameManager with no game objects or automatic game events. It also sets the static 'instance' variable to the object created. This constructor does not start the game loop.

    • Method Detail

      • getInstance

        public static GameManager getInstance()
        This returns the most recently created instance of Game Manager.
        Returns:
        Most recently created Game Manager object.

      • isDebug

        public boolean isDebug()

      • runGame

        public void runGame()
        Starts the game loop.

      • haltGame

        public void haltGame()

      • getGameWindow

        public GameWindow getGameWindow()

      • registerKeyPressed

        public void registerKeyPressed(int keyID)

      • gameLoop

        public void gameLoop()

      • registerObject

        public void registerObject(GameObject object)
        Register a game object. This will result in the game object being updated on cycle, rendered if visible, and considered in collision checks if it is collidable.
        Parameters:
        object - The game object to register.

      • registerEvent

        public void registerEvent(AutomaticGameEvent event)

      • registerInputListener

        public void registerInputListener(GameInput listener)

      • collisionCheck

        public void collisionCheck(GameObject object1)
        Checks for collision between the passed object and all other collidable game objects. The passed object must be collidable for this to work. If a collision is found, onCollide will be called for both objects.
        Parameters:
        object1 - The game object to check for, must be collidable.
